newsitem.title: USA: OrthoLogic says comfortable with estimates.
newsitem.headline: OrthoLogic says comfortable with estimates.

text.p: OrthoLogic Corp chairman and chief officer Allen Weinstein said Tuesday the company's third-quarter earnings per share would be $0.07 to $0.09, and that the company is comfortable with $0.28 earnings per share for the year.

"For the third quarter, we'll be in that range of $0.07 to $0.09. We're pretty comfortable with that ($0.28 per share) for the year," Weinstein told Reuters following a presentation at a Dain Bosworth healthcare conference.
"We've made our investment in the direct sales organization in June and July and now the question is whether or not that investment pays off to make the bottom line," Weinstein said.
He also said the company expected productivity increases as a result of its recent acquisition of Sutter Corp.

"With Sutter, we're doing $400,000 to $425,000 in sales per sales rep. With the leveraged capability of the sales force referral system with Sutter, we would like to see sales go up to about $600,000 per person.
Sutter is a San Diego, Calif.-based manufacturer of continuous passive motion devices.
Weinstein held out the possibility of yet another acquisition this year. "We're definitely looking at additional acquisitions," he said.
